Prerequisites

Bio 264 and Bio 265 must be completed with a "B" or better.

A 3.5 overall GPA is required for application. GPA's Students earned from colleges or universities previously attended are averaged with the BYU-Idaho cumulative GPA to determine overall GPA. This must be 3.5 or in order to qualify. Students are evaludated and ranked using a Score Card. Students are encouraged to print the score card and use to estimate their scorecard total.

The Alternate Track is for students who have 48 credits or more when applying.

  • BIO 264 and BIO 265 must be completed with a "B" or better.
  • A 3.5 GPA is required for application.
  • Students are evaluated using a Score Card and ranked by Score Card total.

For clarification specific to university requirements, please consult with the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Academic Discovery Center at (208) 496-9830.

Selection of Candidates

The BYU-Idaho Nursing Program is a limited enrollment program. Regrettably due to the large number of applicants, all qualified candidates cannot be admitted. Admission to any nursing school is competitive. The faculty of the Department of Nursing recommends that students apply to more than one nursing program. The ASN Admission Scorecard can help students in planning and submitting their application.
